title: Rudy Giuliani ordered to pay $148 million for defaming Georgia poll workers
description: Two former Georgia election workers had sued Donald Trump's former personal lawyer, citing lies he spread about them during the 2020 election that resulted in racist threats and harassment.

title: A Chinese man married to a Frenchman is serving 11 years in prison near Beijing
description: Wu Xianle, 57, was a member of the Communist Party and worked for former president Hu Jintao. His husband, François Dupouy, said he was 'flabbergasted' by the severity of the sentence.

title: Catalonia prepares for major water restrictions amidst historic drought
description: The region's water retention basins are at 17.7% of capacity. A drought emergency could be declared in January 2024.

title: What happens when friends and family disagree over the war in Gaza
description: The war between Hamas and Israel has caused heated discussions between friends and families, with differences in opinion sometimes leading to lasting rifts.

title: Le Monde's favorite champagne estates
description: These two major houses and two independent winemakers stood out in a blind tasting of 200 bottles conducted by three Le Monde journalists.

title: Israeli army says it 'mistakenly' killed three Israeli hostages in Gaza
description: Two of the hostages were identified by Israeli forces as Yotam Haim and Samer El-Talalqa.

title: With the refugees crossing through the only open border post from occupied territory to Ukraine
description: Fleeing towns occupied by Russian forces, residents of Mariupol, Zaporizhzhia and Enerhodar cross into enemy territory in the north-east, to reach their country in the 'free' zone.

title: 'I haven't changed my number': Macron still open to peace dialogue with Putin
description: Speaking after the European Council summit in Brussels, French President Emmanuel Macron said he was open to dialogue it if helps create peace between Ukraine and Russia.

title: In Morocco, Nicolas Sarkozy feels 'at home'
description: During the promotional tour for his latest book, the former French president opened up about his love for Morocco, at a time when relations between Rabat and Paris are at their worst.

title: EU leaders vow to overcome Orban block on Ukraine aid
description: The 27 leaders will reconvene for an emergency summit early next year after they failed to agree to a budget plan including aid for Ukraine.

title: Georgians celebrate EU candidate status
description: Tens of thousands gathered in the capital Tbilisi the day after the European Union granted Georgia candidate status, in the first step toward a possible membership.

title: Hunter Biden's defiant stance in front of US Congress
description: President Joe Biden's son refused on Wednesday to appear behind closed doors before members of the House of Representatives, who are investigating his past financial affairs. He did however hold a public press conference in front of the Capitol.

title: The web of subcontractors behind Russia's online influence operations
description: Online Russian propaganda is propped up by a complicated network of subcontractors that obtain interviews with French celebrities and use private Russian companies and botnets bought on the black market.

title: Climate-related investment in France reached €100 billion in 2022
description: In its new annual overview, the think-tank I4CE substantially increased its estimate of the money required to meet the 2030 emissions reduction target.

title: Prince Harry victim of phone hacking, judge rules
description: A judge ruled that the personal mobile phone of the United Kingdom's Prince Harry was hacked by journalists at Mirror Group Newspapers between 2003 and 2009.

title: Yemen's Houthis put Red Sea on high alert
description: The Iran-backed rebels are stepping up attacks on civilian and military vessels operating in the region, posing a security challenge to Western shipowners and navies.

title: French chefs are determined to put stinky cheeses back on the map
description: Maroilles, Camembert and Munster are just some of the French cheeses that inspire revulsion in people with a sensitive palate. But increasingly strong cheeses are being used by chefs in risky and interesting dishes.

title: Olvid, the French government's 'secure' messaging app, already under fire
description: The prime minister ordered her ministers to use the French-made app rather than alternatives such as Signal or WhatsApp. But critics have pointed out that the app is hosted by Amazon Web Services, subjecting it to American extraterritorial laws.

title: Accession talks with Ukraine: How the EU managed to avoid a Hungarian veto
description: Hungary's Prime Minister Viktor Orban left the European Council room at the moment that 26 European leaders decided to start EU accession talks with Ukraine. He did, however, block €50 billion of aid for Kyiv between now and 2027.

title: British boy Alex Batty found in France six years after disappearance
description: Alex Batty, now 17, was found close to the town of Revel, in the south of France, regional prosecutors said. He had left the UK in 2017 for a family holiday in Spain.

title: 'The United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia are no longer aligned with US policy'
description: Vladimir Putin's official visit to the UAE and Saudi Arabia on December 6 illustrates the emancipation of the Gulf powers from the United States, writes Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon.

title: How Chinese spies gave orders to a far-right European politician
description: Der Spiegel, the Financial Times and Le Monde accessed hundreds of messages exchanged by a Chinese intelligence agent known as Daniel Woo and one of his European contacts, former Belgian MP Frank Creyelman.

title: Israeli army finds body of French-Israeli hostage Elya Toledano
description: Elya Toledano was captured by Hamas militants in the attack on the music festival on October 7.

title: Migrant boat capsizes in English Channel, one person dead
description: One person has died and another is in serious condition after a boat carrying more than 60 people capsized on Thursday night.

title: 'The Crown,' season six, part two: Netflix's moving farewell to the Queen
description: After four unconvincing episodes devoted to the disappearance of Princess Diana, Peter Morgan's series admirably raises the bar for its final episodes.

title: Pornography: The lifelong wounds of victims in the French Bukkake case
description: A porn network filmed and published hundreds of videos of women being assaulted. The plaintiffs are asking the courts to recognize the 'torture' they say they underwent.

title: Israel's use of AI in bombings raises questions over rules of war
description: The number of victims and the unprecedented scale of the damage caused by the Israeli military's bombardment of Gaza have reignited the debate on the use of artificial intelligence in weapons systems.

title: Colombia becomes the first major nation to join the fossil fuel non-proliferation coalition
description: In power since August 2022, left-wing President Gustavo Petro wants to set his country on the path toward an ambitious energy transition.

title: Spanish parents are rallying to ban cell phones for children under 16
description: A series of incidents linked to schoolchildren's social media usage and parental efforts to curb unrestricted smartphone access have sparked a major national debate on the issue.

title: Washington urges Israel to scale down its war in Gaza
description: Israel's defense minister said Thursday it will take 'several months' to 'destroy' Hamas, foreseeing a prolonged conflict. This comes as Israel and its key ally, the United States, face mounting international isolation due to the devastation in Gaza.

title: The Christophe Galtier scandal: Three questions about Ramadan in football
description: The football manager is on trial in Nice on Friday for harassment and discrimination during his time with the local club. He is accused of stigmatizing Muslim players during their fasting period, which he denies.
